title: Does the new Android (version 10 and later) come with a pre-installed music player app? I can't find the former Google Play Music. - Quora

response.answer_text: For playing locally stored music files there is an app simply named Music, it’s basic and works well. If streaming music from the Internet is what you’re seeking, Google’s YouTube Music app is installed on all new Android Devices. Of course there is the Chrome Browser as well which is capable of streaming from music websites. The Google Play Store also hosts several music apps, such as Pandora and Spotify. Google Play Music is a thing of the past, it’s no longer downloadable, supported or functioning.

Google Play Music is gone, sadly, replaced by Youtube. The new one is YouTube Music, which despite the name also plays local music, but… I’m not a fan at all. I switched to JetAudio, but there are many other music apps that are IMHO much better for local music. Combining local and streaming is a little rarer, but Spotify is probably king there.
